title: Data protection register: notify ICO about personal data

details.description: Tell the Information Commissioner's Office (ICO) about personal data used by your business, for inclusion on the data protection register
details.more_information:
If you’re unsure if you need to do this, check using the online self-assessment.

If you don’t notify the ICO you could be committing a criminal offence.

Where your details will appear

Information including your business’s name and the reason for storing the data will appear on the data protection public register.

How much it costs

The annual fee is £35 for most organisations, including small and medium-sized businesses.

It costs £500 if you have 250 or more staff and your business has a turnover of at least £25.9 million.
details.introduction:
Under data protection law, you may have to provide details of how your business handles personal data about staff or customers, for the data protection register.

You’ll need to fill in an online application form and pay a fee.
details.alternate_methods:
ICO Notifications Helpline
01625 545 740
